headline: Super Bowl LVI: Cincinnati officials rally in LA to tout city: PHOTOS
author: Corrie Schaffeld
sentences: On Thursday, they gathered at the Westin LAX with other Cincinnati leaders for a press conference designed to help the city capture some of the international spotlight now shining on the Queen City's football team.
Mike DeWine is bringing 19 family members to cheer on the Cincinnati Bengals Sunday against the "Loss Angeles" Rams, as Cincinnati Mayor Aftab Pureval jokingly called them earlier in the day.
DeWine and Pureval were two of the elected officials who made the trek to California to support the Bengals in their first Super Bowl appearance since 1989.
Courier photographer Corrie Schaffeld was on site Thursday to capture the event; click through the slideshow above to go inside.
"This is no longer your grandparents' Cincinnati," Pureval told reporters.
